daaniafazal: Thanks for sharing this and bring it out of its shadow.. a lot of people go through this process every few weeks, and hell yeah its a struggle, it fricken sucks and I hate it so much! But I appreciate you sharing that you do it too.. #livetinted

debra.sh: You should give electrolysis a try. I’ve tried everything before electrolysis. Electrolysis made such a difference with the amount of hair I have on my face. carolineelliotttv: Bliss spa has an awesome wax you can heat in your microwave and just do at home at your convenience. Highly recommend! Not an ad!
y.mazhar: Laser has been life saving for me. Best investment ever made
hebaglobin: Any honest laser hair removal place should admit that laser doesn't work on finer hair like fuzz on the face. It only works on very coarse body hair. rehanad96: I go through the same thing . Every two weeks id be threading and waxing my face .. so tired of th fast growth of facial hair😣😣😣
psethi5: Thank you for sharing!! desirousmuse: The struggle is real. I have to wax my face every WEEK. Four days in and my chin is covered. It is so embarrassing and I am thinking of doing laser but man it is a struggle

haseena.samtani: @deepica have you tried dermaplaning? I’m so curious, I feel your pain!
chicmom2011: @deepica yes I can relate...I have whole body laser with pretty good reduction, about 60%. sruthi12: Right there with you!!! No shame
shivana: Try electrolysis! Was threading for years now I don’t have to 🙌🏽🙌🏽

janineronda: Do you use anything on your face right after threading? Any moisturizer or toner? Would love to know! x
innavative: I’ve tried laser three separate times, with 4 different people, and 2 different styles of machines(gel vs cold air) and for some reason, my hair just grew back coarser, i tried electrolysis which seemed like it was working, but it takes FOREVER to do it to your entire face, and it kinda hurts a lot when each individual follicle is burned off 😭
uresha74: I’m definitely one who can relate! Price we pay to feel pretty!
keshirarihsek: It feels like a massage after a while! I've been getting mine done for the last 4 years, best decision I made! Favourite part is when your face feels like silk after!!!!! Your face is a dolphin gliding!!!
amrpatel30: Laser worked partly but too forever still not perfect. Yep- the threading never stops!
theorigin.elle: @deepica you are a champion I tried this ☝🏽 time and I barely got passed the lip before I told her “that will be all” I stick to brows only. 😅
shalinisarena: Hairy girl problems like woah! Why didn’t laser work for you hon? Would love to hear your feedback. Hope all is well! x
its.sita: THIS! There is SO much upkeep and it feels like it never goes away. I’m “lucky” my mom started teaching me about waxing when I was getting teased for my mustache at 11 years old (I mean I did have more of a mustache than the boys in my class lmao). It’s literally been more than a decade and I know I have the rest of my life to deal with it. I tried laser recently, but I’m mixed so some of my hair has lighter roots, so the tech said it may not take. 😒 Body hair is such an every day part of my life, but us brown girls feel so much shame around discussing it because we’re expected to suffer in silence and just deal.
iluvbri: Why do we have to deal with so much more hair than we should. I’ll never forget the day I got teased for my hairy arms and mustache I went home that day and shaved everything off and haven’t looked back lol.
lindsay_nunya83: I get my brows done but haven't thought about getting my face done! I might have to try it.
dreamindulgences: I got Electrolysis done on my chin area and it has done wonders in just 5 sittings. I don't do it anymore. It is painful though but you can get numbing creams. Worth it!!!
bthorn00: I relate to this so much!! With black hair, facial peach fuzz is so noticeable, I hate it around my eyes. And when I see my face in sunlight and there’s a layer of hair illuminated lol. I need my whole body threaded
only_anniemarie: Man how do u just sit there lol. I cry every time I get threaded. And they aren’t happy tears!! 😂😂
asmasidd: This was me last weekend ugh. Hate doing it so much, but hate how I look if I don’t do it 😭

tannacious: This is my life story. Eyebrows & upper lips: every two weeks, Brazilian & Armpits: every four weeks, & Legs: every 6 to 8 weeks. I have to plan wearing dresses around this schedule. I always felt (and still do) self conscious about my body hair that other girls didn't have to deal with (dark hair shows up no matter what). I was called Chewbacca in middle school and asked if I was part monkey/ape because of my unibrow, thick hair, and hairy legs. _laksh19_: Omg I feel you girrl! I didn't really have a problem before but now due to hormonal changes Ive looking like a bit of a gorilla for the last few years. I used to wax as threading was wayyyy to painful for me. I did stop all kind of hair removal for about 2 years whilst at uni after having a bad experience with a lady burning parts of my face with hot wax and not even saying sorry. Over the last month I've been feeling reallyyy self conscious about my peach fuzz and got it waxed after so long. And my skin reacted (I have very sensitive skin) and within 2 weeks I had to go back to get the hair removed coz it was growing back and at a quicker rate. I got it threaded this time (about a week ago) my whole face and neck area and my God the pain! And my face is still sensitive from it. I am getting lil spots and my face and it is all bumpy from where the hair has been removed from the root (so not a nice sight when u put makeup on coz the skin isn't as smooth as it usually is). But Im determined to get it done regularly despite the pain and the after effects in the hopes my skin will become less sensitive and my peach fuzz will grow back less. If you have an tips on aftercare I'd appreciate it! 😘
